articles.title: Response to Inter-Korean Red Cross Working Contact Urged Again
articles.content:
Response to Inter-Korean Red Cross Working Contact Urged Again
						
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the C.C., the DPRK Red Cross Society Friday sent a notice to the president of the south Korean Red Cross, again urging response to the proposed north-south Red Cross working contact. The south Korean authorities have refused the contact for discussing the matter for face-to-face confirmation and repatriation of the four inhabitants of the DPRK detained in south Korea. 
					 Expressing regret over their refusal, the notice said: The irrefutable fact that the south side persistently conducted "operation for defection" among our citizens has been disclosed by 27 inhabitants who returned to the north side on March 27.
					
					 If there was no "operation for defection" by the south side and "defection" of the four inhabitants was made at their "own will", there will be no reason to deny the north side's confirmation through face-to-face meeting, it said.
					
					 It further said: If the south Korean authorities still stand against the face-to-face meeting with the four detainees, we cannot but recognize that they have been abducted through appeasement. Such attitude will seriously affect the north-south relations. 
					
					 The notice strongly demanded immediate Red Cross working contact.

articles.title: National Meeting of Activists in Field of Fruit Farming Held
articles.content:
National Meeting of Activists in Field of Fruit Farming Held
						
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A national meeting of activists in the field of fruit farming took place in Pukchong County, South Hamgyong Province, on Friday.
					 Present there were Choe Yong Rim and Kim Ki Nam and officials of working people's organizations and members of the Cabinet, officials of local party, power and economic bodies, those in the field of fruit farming and exemplary scientists, technicians and working people.
					
					 Vice-Premier Kim Rak Hui made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers referred to the fact that President Kim Il Sung clearly indicated the orientation and ways for developing the fruit farming in every period of the revolutionary development and at its every stage. 
					
					 The President opened a bright prospect for increasing the fruit production at the Pukchong Enlarged Meeting of the Presidium of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, they said, adding it marked a turning point in developing the fruit farming of the country.
					
					 They went on to say:
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il made public work "On Bringing About a New Turn in Developing the Fruit Farming" and other works, providing important guidelines for developing the nation's fruit farming as required by the new century.
					
					 In recent years Kim Jong Il saw to it that the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm was established as a model for the whole country, thus bringing about a signal change in developing the fruit farming in the era of Songun.
					
					 Referring to the successes made in the field of fruit farming in recent years, they stressed that the credit for them goes to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They called on the officials and other working people in the field of fruit farming to effect a signal boost in the production in response to the WPK's plan for building an economic power and thus make a positive contribution to bringing about a drastic turn in improving the people's standard of living.

articles.title: Anniversary of Pukchong Enlarged Meeting Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Pukchong Enlarged Meeting Marked 
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A national meeting took place in Pukchong County, South Hamgyong Province, Friday on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the historic Pukchong Enlarged Meeting of the Presidium of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea guided by President Kim Il Sung. 
					 At the enlarged meeting held on April 7, Juche 50 (1961) the President opened a rosy prospect of developing fruit farming in a big way through an all-people movement for creating orchards. 
					
					 Present there were Choe Yong Rim, Kim Ki Nam and members of the Cabinet, working people's organizations, the party and power and economic bodies in South Hamgyong Province and officials and workers in the field of fruit farming. 
					
					 Prior to the meeting, the participants heard the recorded concluding speech "On Planting Orchards through an All-People Movement" made by the President at the enlarged meeting. 
					
					 Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C. C., the WPK and premier of the Cabinet, said in his report that the President's concluding speech fully reflecting his intention to build a socialist paradise on the land of socialist Korea has served as a banner encouraging the Korean people to wage a new heroic struggle and perform exploits. 
					
					 After the meeting the President wisely led the drive to create orchards in a big way, the reporter said, and went on:
					
					 Under his energetic leadership a dynamic work was carried out to create orchards in all parts of the country following the example set by Pukchong County. As a result, orchards covering tens of thousands of hectares were created in 1961 and the area of orchards increased 1.5 times in 1963 as compared with that in 1960. 
					
					 The noble plan and desire of the President to amply provide the people with fruits by developing the fruit farming onto a higher stage have become realities thanks to the energetic leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The reporter called on all the officials and other working people in the field of fruit farming to bring about a fresh revolutionary turn in the development of the fruit farming in hearty response to the militant appeal of the WPK for dynamically waging an all-out offensive, an all-out charge to translate the President's wish to build a rich and powerful country into reality.

articles.title: Delegation of 2011 Women's World Cup Organizing Committee Here
articles.content:
Delegation of 2011 Women's World Cup Organizing Committee Here
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Organizing Committee for the 2011 Women's World Cup led by Theo Zwanziger, president of the German Football Association, arrived here today.

articles.title: New School Year Begins
articles.content:
New School Year Begins
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A new school year for Juche 100 (2011) has begun in the DPRK.
					 Preparations for the new school year ranging from school fixtures to school uniforms and supplies were completed at schools throughout the country.
					
					 Opening ceremonies of the school year have been held at all universities, colleges and primary and secondary schools on Friday.
					
					 At Pyongyang Secondary School No. 1, newcomers entered the campus together with their parents, welcomed by teachers and students with brass and ticker tapes. 
					
					 Ri Kwi Suk, a teacher of the school, told KCNA that she is proud of teaching children.
					
					 Wi Mun, a new pupil, vowed to study hard to become a scientist.
					
					 The opening ceremony was followed by the first class.

articles.title: New Solar Collector Developed
articles.content:
New Solar Collector Developed
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Heat Engineering Institute of the State Academy of Sciences has developed a new kind of uniaxial solar collector.
					 The collector is designed to use any shape of solar panel following the sun.
					
					 The light device is low in production cost.
					
					 When it is applied to a solar cooker, it keeps heat for more than 20 hours. It can accumulate heat and provide heat for cooking simultaneously. The accumulated heat is enough for preparing supper and breakfast.
					
					 The device is proper to households in rural communities and flat areas.

articles.title: White Cranes Protected
articles.content:
White Cranes Protected 
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- White cranes with red crest are under protection in the DPRK.
					 The total number of white crane in the world, mainly in Korea, China and Russia, is some 2 700.
					
					 Its largest habitat on the Korean peninsula is an area of Kangwon Province.
					
					 The DPRK government has taken legal and practical measures for protecting the habitats of the bird.
					
					 The habitat in Kangwon Province was registered as a reserve last year.
					
					 The State Academy of Sciences has cooperated with international organizations to provide favorable living conditions to white cranes in winter.
					
					 Yun Chol Nam, a section chief of the Research Center for Biodiversity and Eco-Engineering under the State Academy of Sciences, told KCNA that a nationwide attention has been paid to the protection of migratory birds like white crane.

articles.title: Infant Paduk Star
articles.content:
Infant Paduk Star
						
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Ri Ji Hyang, a six-year-old girl, has come into prominence as an infant puduk (go) star.
					 She won the technical prize at the Pyongyang Spring Children's Paduk Contest (kindergarteners' class) held some time ago.
					
					 It was her first success after she began learning paduk six months ago.
					
					 She is gifted with excellent judgment and composure. She is also witty in moves.
					
					 Her coaches of the Sinwon Paduk House in Pothonggang District, Pyongyang, have introduced computer in training her.
					
					 The girl is in hard training for a soon-to-be-held national paduk contest.

articles.title: Yanggak Islet in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Yanggak Islet in Pyongyang
						
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- There is Yanggak Islet on the Taedong River in Pyongyang. 
					 Yanggak means sheep horn. The islet covers 1.2 square kilometers and is 7 kilometers around.
					
					 There are sports, cultural and amusement facilities in both sides of the Yanggak Bridge across the middle of the islet.
					
					 Local and foreign films are screened on a regular basis and international film festivals take place at the Pyongyang International Cinema.
					
					The cinema has large and small theatres with a total of more than 3,000 seats.  
					
					Yanggakdo Football Stadium has a seating capacity of more than 30,000 seats.
					
					 The stadium, with a grass field and running track of international standard, is surrounded by football training grounds and tennis courts.
					
					 Standing in the northern tip of the islet is the Yanggakdo International Hotel. The islet looks like a boat floating on the river and the hotel its mast.
					
					 The 47-storied hotel, with some 1,000 rooms, is one of the large hotels in the country.
					
					 The hotel is equipped with a health center, golf course and other entertainment facilities, as well as a rotating restaurant on the top.

articles.title: Canal Park in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Canal Park in Pyongyang
						
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- There is a large pleasure resort called a "canal park" along the Pothong River in the center of Pyongyang.
					 The pleasure resort, involving some islets, ponds, groves, flowerbeds, amusement facilities and boating and staking grounds, covers more than 360 hectares. 
					
					 On the banks of the river there are streets with many apartment houses, including Mansudae, Chollima and Changgwangwon streets.
					
					 The river is also flanked with the Pothong River Improvement Project Memorial Tower, the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower, the People's Palace of Culture, the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium, the Ice Rink, the Changgwang Health Complex and other sports and tourist facilities.

articles.title: Captured US Spy Ship on Show
articles.content:
Captured US Spy Ship on Show 
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A U.S. spy ship, "Pueblo", is on show on the River Taedong, drawing many people.
					 The 1 000-ton vessel boarded by some 80 crewmen was captured by the navy of the DPRK in January Juche 57 (1968) after entering its territorial waters for an espionage mission, at the dictation of the CIA.
					
					 After the capture, the United States threatened the DPRK militarily. But it could not but make a written apology in December that year, daunted by the Korean people's staunch position. The vessel has been well known in the world ever since.
					
					 The spy ship serves as a reminder of the U.S. persistent military threat to the DPRK.
					
					 Preserved inside the ship are what they used for espionage.
					
					 The ship was brought to the spot where the U.S. ship "General Sherman" was sunk in 1866 after entering the river.

articles.title: Korean Jewel Painting
articles.content:
Korean Jewel Painting
						
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Jewel painting is a special form of pictorial art created by the Korean people.
					 The form was created in the 1980s, called Korean jewel painting, in order to keep art works from becoming discolored.
					
					 A Korean jewel painting group was organized at the Mansudae Art Studio.
					
					 The jewel painting opened a new chapter in the development of the Juche-based fine art, winning a great popularity in the world.
					
					 Its material is powdered natural jewel or paste.
					
					 The jewel painting is characterized by elegant colors and a mixture of arts and crafts.
					
					 Local people and foreign tourists enjoy Korean jewel paintings at the Korean Art Gallery, Mansudae Art Studio and other places.

articles.title: Papers Call for Working as Befitting Descendants of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Papers Call for Working as Befitting Descendants of Kim Il Sung
						
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun in an editorial Friday calls upon all the people to work and create as befitting descendants of President Kim Il Sung and dynamically struggle for a new victory of the Juche revolution, closely rallied around the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 It is the unanimous desire and steadfast will of the army and people of the DPRK to move any mountain and capture the fortress of latest science and technology at a breath and successfully build a thriving nation under the slogan "Work and create as befitting descendants of the great Comrade Kim Il Sung!" the editorial says, adding:
					
					 Descendant of Kim Il Sung--this is the highest dignity, honor and pride that can be taken by the army and people of the DPRK. Herein lies the eternal dignity of the Korean nation. 
					
					 To work and create as befitting descendants of Kim Il Sung is the supreme duty and obligation of the Korean army and people, and it is the practical demand of the present era of great surge. 
					
					 The President is the father and benefactor of all our people. 
					
					 The ultimate goal in life and struggle for descendants of any leader is to accomplish his or her cause. To the Korean army and people who grew up under the care of the President, nothing is more important than to preserve and glorify his idea and exploits and carry into practice his intention and ideal. 
					
					 The great drive for building a thriving nation now under way is a sacred campaign to translate the lifelong wishes of the President into reality. We must implement his behests 100 percent, regarding them as our motto and important guideline. This is the way for glorifying the dignity and honor of being descendants of the President. 
					
					 The high honor of being his descendants provides us with pluck for creation, and it serves as the source of heroic feats and the key to great innovation and rapid progress. There is nothing impossible to carry out when all the people speed up the great revolutionary surge, making rapid progress on all fronts as befitting the descendants of the President. 
					
					 Minju Joson in its editorial calls for bringing about a decisive turn in the improvement of the people's living standard to carry into reality what the President desired.

articles.title: S. Korean Marine Corps Stages Shelling Exercises
articles.content:
S. Korean Marine Corps Stages Shelling Exercises
						
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The puppet marine corps conducted shelling exercises on Paekryong Island and Yonphyong Island in the West Sea of Korea on March 30 under the simulated conditions of a preemptive attack on the DPRK, according to KBS of south Korea. 
					 The warmongers fired all type shells into waters southwest of Paekryong Island and southeast of Yonphyong Island, fanning up war hysteria.

articles.title: Scheme for Nuclear War Exercises Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Scheme for Nuclear War Exercises Protested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea on March 28 accused the U.S. and south Korean warmongers of their scheme for nuclear war exercises. 
					 The authorities of south Korea and the U.S. are to discuss a plan on staging exercises for operation of extended deterrent by sponsoring the first full-dress session of the committee for policy on extended deterrence at the 28th meeting on security policy initiative, which will be held for two days, starting that day. 
					
					 Recalling this fact, the organization said: The U.S. seeks to draw south Korea into its MD system in a bid to precipitate the crisis of nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula and thus trigger off a nuclear arms race and check conclusion of peace treaty.
					
					 In case the plan is carried into practice, it will result in south Korea's stronger dependence on the U.S. and huge financial burdens, to say nothing of outbreak of a nuclear war, it warned. 
					
					 Strongly rejecting the committee dealing with this dangerous plan, the organization urged the authorities of south Korea and the U.S. to put an immediate halt to it.

articles.title: Miserable Plight of S. Korean Students
articles.content:
Miserable Plight of S. Korean Students 
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- 200-300 students commit suicides annually in south Korea, driven to the bottom of destitution, south Korean CBS reported recently.
					 These suicides are attributable to frustrations and pessimism, hopelessness and melancholy caused by staggering registration fee and worry about unemployment.
					
					 The number of those who committed suicides in agony of the registration fee in 2008 and 2009 reached more than 580, according to the data made public by the puppet National Police Agency.
					
					 The number of those who choose death is on the steady increase in south Korea. A student in Kangrung, south Korean Kangwon Province, committed suicide in last February, leaving a paper for making a loan of school expenses and two lottery cards behind instead of a will.

articles.title: US-S. Korea Military Exercises Flayed by Peruvians
articles.content:
US-S. Korea Military Exercises Flayed by Peruvians
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian Committee for Solidarity with Peoples issued a statement on March 25 in protest against the joint military exercises by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK proposed to have wide-ranging dialogue and negotiations with political parties and organizations of south Korea including its authorities. It showed the international community the DPRK's efforts to defuse the acute tension prevailing on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 But, the south Korean group of traitors launched dangerous military exercises instead of responding to the proposal.
					
					 This proves that the group has no willingness to improve the north-south relations.
					
					 The U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises are part of war scheme for aggression on the DPRK.
					
					 Neither huge nuclear offensive means aimed at preemptive attack nor any moves will frighten the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK does not mount preemptive attack on anyone but has self-defensive deterrent.
					
					 We strongly condemn the U.S. and the south Korean puppet group for their hostile moves against the DPRK.
					
					 The Committee struggling for global peace calls upon the progressive people of the world to heighten the vigilance against the U.S. moves to ignite a new war.

articles.title: Notice on Day of Sun Issued by British Organizations
articles.content:
Notice on Day of Sun Issued by British Organizations
						
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The British preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and the Coordinating Committee of the British Friends of the DPRK issued a notice on March 25 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, the birthday of the President.
					 This year, the DPRK is forwarding multifarious plans to defend the gains of the revolution and bring about a decisive turn in improving the people's standard of living, the notice said, referring to the Korean people's efforts to open the gate to a thriving nation at an early date.
					
					 The organizations will widely introduce the great revolutionary life and immortal feats of Kim Il Sung and arrange a joint seminar with a view to further strengthening the friendship with the DPRK, it said.
					
					 The notice also stressed the need to hold a seminar on such themes as the Korean people's efforts for building a thriving nation, the Juche idea and the Songun politics, the socialist system of the DPRK and the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Il Adopted at Seminar in Pakistan
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Il Adopted at Seminar in Pakistan
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A letter to General Secretary Kim Jong Il was adopted at a national seminar on the Juche idea for self-reliance and economic development held in Pakistan on Mar. 19.
					 The letter said:
					
					 The Juche idea is, indeed, a great idea that helps the world progressives arm themselves with it and struggle against all forms of oppression, injustice and exploitation.  
					
					 We are sure that the Korean people will register greater success in building a thriving nation on the occasions of the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and your birthday in 2012.
					
					 We are convinced that the world conference on the Juche idea will mark a historic event in the 21st century.
					
					 Everyone looks up to the progress, prosperity and great development made in the DPRK and admires at the seasoned leadership of you who have turned it into a bulwark of socialism despite manifold hardships and trials.
					
					 We hope that Korea will enjoy greater glory under your wise leadership.
					
					 All the participants in the seminar have keenly felt it is due to your sincere efforts that the Juche idea and the Songun policy have been spread over to various parts of the world.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Austria and a seminar in Russia on March 22 and 24 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Adolf Wurzer, chairman of the Austrian preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, said that Kim Il Sung is the eternal President of the DPRK as he liberated Korea through armed struggle against the Japanese imperialists, founded the DPRK and turned it into a powerful socialist state.
					
					 His great feats will remain long in the hearts of not only the Korean people but also the progressives of the world, the chairman stressed.
					
					 Solinov, general manager of a company of the Russian Technical Glass Research Institute, said that the President's life is brilliant one dedicated to the freedom and independence of the country and the nation and the happiness and prosperity of the people.

articles.title: Japanese Government Accused of Passing History Textbooks
articles.content:
Japanese Government Accused of Passing History Textbooks
						
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Japanese Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology on Wednesday examined and passed all the geography textbooks and 12 kinds of textbooks for junior high schools which contain a claim to Tok Islets, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 These textbooks misrepresent past history including the theory of "Japanese Prefecture of Imna," Japan's invasion of Korea in 1592, the Kanghwa Island Treaty, the Japanese imperialists' occupation of Korea and forcible mobilization and do not have any mention about the issue of comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					
					 This action taken by the Japanese ministry is touching off protest from the different circles of south Korea.
					
					 The Media Persons' Society of Churches of south Korea in a commentary lashed out at the Japanese authorities for going reckless in their wild ambition for territorial aggrandizement.
					
					 The Solidarity for Peace in Asia and Education in History held a press conference on the same day strongly denouncing the Japanese government's distortion of history.
					
					 The Solidarity for Protecting Tok Islets at a meeting outside the Japanese embassy in Seoul declared that the Japanese government's distortion of history is a deliberate provocation, urging an immediate expulsion of the Japanese ambassador from south Korea.

articles.title: Radioactive Substance Spreads Worldwide from Japan
articles.content:
Radioactive Substance Spreads Worldwide from Japan
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA)--The radioactive materials that leaked from the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant of Japan keep spreading to other countries and regions. 
					 Reuters on March 28 reported that radioactive substance believed to have leaked from the power plant was detected in the air over North Carolina and South Carolina and Florida States of the U.S. 
					
					 Earlier, it was confirmed that such substance was detected in Hawaii, California, Nevada and Massachusetts and other states. 
					
					 Trace amounts of radioactive substance were detected in the air over Vietnam and it was also found in Glasgow City of Scotland. 
					
					 The radioactive iodine detected in an area of south Korea spread to all its areas as of Wednesday, stoking uneasiness among inhabitants, according to south Korean KBS.
					
					 In the afternoon of Tuesday radioactive substance 3 355 times the legal limit was detected in the seawater near the power plant. This was the highest-ever.
					
					 That day Prime Minister Naoto Kan, addressing a meeting of the Budget Committee of the House of Councilors, expressed his view that there was high likelihood of closing the power plant. 
					
					 In the meantime, the Japan National Police Agency announced that the death toll caused by the quake and the ensuing tsunami increased to 11,257 and the number of those unaccounted for to 16 344 as of 3 p.m. of Wednesday. 
					
					  Aftershocks are going on. 
					
					 On Wednesday quake of magnitude 5.3 jolted Chiba Prefecture and areas around it. 
					
					 The epicenter was some 20 km under water in the sea off the prefecture.

articles.title: Mauritius Suspends Importation of Some Japanese Products
articles.content:
Mauritius Suspends Importation of Some Japanese Products
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Mauritius decided to temporarily suspend the importation of Japanese products, said the country's Commerce and Industry Minister.
					 The minister said the decision was taken during a cabinet meeting held on March 27, adding it would be only target products from the regions being affected by the radiation emitted from the nuclear stations following the earthquake and tsunami early this month.

articles.title: Quake Hits Peru
articles.content:
Quake Hits Peru
						
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 5.2 on the Richter scale jolted central Peru on Sunday. 
					 The epicenter was 155.9 km under ground.

articles.title: Cambodian PM Expresses Concern over Arms Race in World
articles.content:
Cambodian PM Expresses Concern over Arms Race in World
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Sen said Monday weaponry race among some countries in the world has increased and cost a great amount of money every year. 
					 "Arms race has not declined at all; it's on the rise in the world today since the collapse of the former-Soviet Union, known as the end of the Cold War," he said during a graduation ceremony. 
					
					 He said recently the U.S. recognized that it has spent 100 billion U.S. dollars a year in the war in Afghanistan. If the money were used to build among the U.S., or to help developing countries, it would be great assistance for development," he added.

articles.title: Bolivian FM on Boosting Relations with Brazil
articles.content:
Bolivian FM on Boosting Relations with Brazil
						
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Bolivian foreign minister at a recent press conference referred to the development of relations with Brazil. 
					 He highlighted the importance of diversifying ties with Brazil, which is Bolivia's main trading partner. 
					
					 He also declared the need to keep moving forward in the consolidation of the Union of South American Nations, an integration mechanism supported by both governments.

articles.title: Russian FM on Afghan Issue
articles.content:
Russian FM on Afghan Issue
 Moscow, March 30 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov referred to the Afghan issue on Mar. 28 in his speech made after the talks with his Kirgyz counterpart.  
					 He termed proper the Afghan authorities' stand that they cannot tolerate the frequent death of their inhabitants due to the operations of the coalition forces. 
					
					 He clarified that Russia and Kirgyzstan are paying attention to coping with the threat from Afghanistan and conducting anti-terror, anti-drug cooperation through the bilateral channel and within the framework of the Collective Security Treaty Organization and the Shanghai Cooperation Organization in order to meet the challenge from it.

articles.title: More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
articles.content:
More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- More NATO soldiers were killed in Afghanistan due to offensive operations of the resistance forces of the country. 
					 Three International Security Assistance Force service members died following separate insurgent attacks in southern and eastern Afghanistan on March 26 and 29.
					
					 More than 100 NATO soldiers, with majority of them Americans, have been killed since January this year in Afghanistan.

articles.title: China's Step to Strengthen Management of Important Foodstuffs
articles.content:
China's Step to Strengthen Management of Important Foodstuffs 
						
 Beijing, March 30 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the General Office of the State Council of China rolled out its annual working plan to beef up food safety in 2011. 
					 According to the plan, China will specifically target dairy products, edible oils, health-promoting food, meat, food additives and alcohol in its food safety campaign this year.  
					
					 A leading official of the Food Safety Commission Office under the State Council said that it is urgent to settle the outstanding problems arising in this work, adding that various measures would be taken to ensure the qualitative security of important foodstuffs.

articles.title: China's Plan to Develop Water Transport
articles.content:
China's Plan to Develop Water Transport
 Beijing, March 30 (KCNA) -- Zhang Dejiang, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council, at a recent ground-breaking ceremony for building high-class waterways in rivers of the country, underscored the need to improve the management of waterways and develop water transport.  
					 What is important here is to choose important objects, set clear-cut goals and improve service and management in an effort to build a stable and green water transport system, he added.

articles.title: Meeting for Clean-handed Political Work Held in China
articles.content:
Meeting for Clean-handed Political Work Held in China 
 Beijing, March 30 (KCNA) -- The State Council of China called the 4th meeting for clean-handed political work on March 25. 
					 Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and premier of the State Council, at the meeting underlined the need for the leading officials to be upright and honest in life, fully eliminate luxury, waste and formalism and achieve fresh successes in enforcing clean-handed politics and combating corruption.

articles.title: US Human Rights Abuses Blasted by Cuban Paper
articles.content:
US Human Rights Abuses Blasted by Cuban Paper
 Havana, March 30 (KCNA) -- The Cuban paper Granma on March 25 carried an article blasting U.S. human rights abuses at the U.S. prisons. 
					 Two of the three prisoners in the U.S. are immigrants who were arrested on charge of violation of the Immigration Law, it said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. government inflicts penalties upon them and treats them like ordinary criminals after putting them in convict clothes and chains. They are given just one third of the food to be served.
					
					 Prison conditions are baffling description. 50 prisoners are detained in a small ill-ventilated room at some prisons.

articles.title: Second International Nowrouz Festival Held in Iran
articles.content:
Second International Nowrouz Festival Held in Iran
						
 Teheran, March 30 (KCNA) -- The Second International Nowrouz Festival was held in Teheran, Iran, on March 27.
					 Present at the festival were presidents of different countries including Iran, Tajikistan and Armenia and governmental high-ranking officials.  
					
					 Diverse cultural and art events were held and a declaration on positively preserving the tradition of Nowrouz was issued at the festival. 
					
					 Nowrouz means the new year in Persian language so it is celebrated in Iran, Azerbaijan, India, Tajikistan, Pakistan, Turkey, Uzbekistan and other countries.

articles.title: Presidente del CC de ACR urge de nuevo contacto a su par surcoreano
articles.content:
Presidente del CC de ACR urge de nuevo contacto a su par surcoreano
						
Pyongyang, 1 de abril (ATCC) -- En relacion con que las autoridades surcoreanas rehusaron el contacto de trabajo de cruz roja N-S para debatir la entrevista directa con 4 norcoreanos retenidos en el Sur de Corea y la devolucion de ellos, el presidente del Comite Central de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea envio el dia primero a su homologo surcoreano otro aviso exigiendole aceptar la propuesta correspondiente de la RPDC.
					El aviso expresa lastima por esa negativa de las autoridades surcoreanas y agrega que a traves de las declaraciones de 27 habitantes devueltos el 27 de marzo a la RPDC, se ha revelado de manera irrefutable el hecho de que la parte Sur realizo obstinadamente la "operacion para someter" a los retenidos.
					
					Si no hubo tal "operacion" y 4 habitantes nuestros "optaron libremente" por quedarse en suelo surcoreano, no habria ningun motivo de negar la entrevista de nuestros funcionarios con ellos para verificarlo directamente, apunta.
					
					Si las autoridades surcoreanas siguen evadiendo la entrevista directa, consideraremos que los 4 fueron seducidos y raptados y esto tendra graves consecuencias en las relaciones intercoreanas, senala y vuelve a demandar fuertemente abrir inmediatamente el contacto de cruz roja.

articles.title: Efectuada reunion nacional de activistas de la rama fruticola
articles.content:
Efectuada reunion nacional de activistas de la rama fruticola 
						
Pyongyang, 1 de abril (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar este viernes en el distrito de Pukchong de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur la reunion nacional de activistas de la rama fruticola.
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes Choe Yong Rim, Kim Ki Nam, los miembros del Consejo de Ministros, los funcionarios de las entidades de masas, las instituciones locales del partido, el Poder y la economia, de fruticultura y otras ramas vinculadas, ejemplares cientificos, tecnicos y trabajadores.
					
					  En el foro hubo el informe de Kim Rak Hui, vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros, y otras intervenciones.
					
					  La informante y otros oradores se refirieron a que el Presidente Kim Il Sung aclaro la direccion y los remedios para desarrollar la fruticultura en cada epoca y cada etapa de la revolucion en desarrollo.
					
					  Especialmente, el dilucido el remedio para aumentar la produccion de frutas en la Reunion Ampliada de Pukchong del Presidium del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, lo cual motivo el cambio trascendental en la fruticultura del pais, destacaron.
					
					  Apuntaron que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il publico varias obras incluida "Para producir nuevo viraje en el desarrollo de fruticultura" para preparar la guia programatica que permita desarrollar la fruticultura del pais conforme a la demanda del nuevo siglo.
					
					  Senalaron que recientemente, el Dirigente hizo acondicionar como modelo de todo el pais la Granja Fruticola Combinada Taedonggang abriendo asi el periodo de gran viraje para el desarrollo fruticola de la epoca del Songun.
					
					  Mencionaron los exitos logrados en esta rama en los ultimos anos y subrayaron que estos son frutos de la sabia guia del Dirigente.
					
					  Exhortaron a los funcionarios y trabajadores de la rama a registrar un auge productivo en acato al proyecto del PTC sobre la construccion de una potencia economica y contribuir mucho a producir el viraje decisivo en la mejora de la vida del pueblo.

articles.title: Acto central por 50o aniversario de reunion ampliada de Pukchong
articles.content:
Acto central por 50o aniversario de reunion ampliada de Pukchong
						
Pyongyang, 1 de abril (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar este viernes en el distrito de Pukchong de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur el acto central por el 50o aniversario de la reunion ampliada de Pukchong del Presidium del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea dirigida por el Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					El Presidente convoco esta reunion el 7 de abril del 50 (1961) de la Era Juche y abrio la radiante perspectiva para desarrollar en gran medida la fruticultura mediante el movimiento masivo para crear las huertas frutales. 
					
					Estuvieron presentes ahi Choe Yong Rim, Kim Ki Nam, los miembros del Consejo de Ministros, funcionarios de entidades de masas y de los organismos del partido, el Poder y la economia de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur, funcionarios y trabajadores de la rama fruticola. 
					
					Ante todo, los participantes en el presente acto escucharon la grabacion del discurso resumen pronunciado por el Presidente en aquel entonces "Para desarrollar un movimiento de todo el pueblo para la creacion de huertas frutales".
					
					El informe de la ocasion estuvo a cargo de Choe Yong Rim, miembro del Presidium del uro Politico del CC del PTC y primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, quien dijo que el aquel discurso resumen del Presidente refleja su proposito de construir sobre el territorio patrio un paraiso socialista del pueblo y estimulo al pueblo coreano a la nueva lucha heroica y meritos. 
					
					Despues de terminada la reunion, el Presidente condujo a la cabeza la labor para crear en gran medida las huertas frutales, senalo el informante y agrego que bajo su energica guia, todas las localidades del pais libraron con dinamismo esta labor siguiendo el ejemplo del distrito de Pukchong, gracias a lo cual se crearon en 1961 decenas de miles de hectareas de huertas frutales y en 1963 se incremento el area de huertas frutales del pais a 1.5 veces mas que en 1960, recordo. 
					
					El noble proposito y deseo del Presidente de llevar a una nueva etapa la fruticultura del pais y suministrar suficientes frutas a los habitantes se realizan gracias a la energica orientacion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, destaco.
					
					Todos los funcionarios y trabajadores de la rama fruticola deben registrar un nuevo viraje revolucionario en el desarrollo de la fruticultura, en pleno acato al llamamiento combativo del partido de librar con dinamismo la ofensiva general para llevar a la realidad el anhelo del Presidente de construir una patria prospera, concluyo.

articles.title: Entidades surcoreanas censuran a Japon por manuales tergiversados
articles.content:
Entidades surcoreanas censuran a Japon por manuales tergiversados
						
Pyongyang, 1 de abril (ATCC) -- Segun la cadena surcoreana Yonhap News, el Ministerio de Educacion, Cultura, Deporte, Ciencia y Tecnologia de Japon aprobo todos los manuales de geografia para escuelas secundarias y 12 manuales de civiles, en los cuales se reclama la "soberania de Japon sobre el islote Tok".
					Esos libros tergiversan ademas los hechos historicos comoteoria de "Mimana Miyake",  la Guerra Patriotica Imjin (1592-1598), el "Tratado de la isla Kanghwa", la ocupacion de Corea por Japon, la movilizacion forzada de coreanos, etc. y ni siquiera hacen referencia al tema de las ex "consoladoras sexuales para el ejercito japones".
					
					Esto ha disparado fuertes protestas en diferentes sectores del Sur de Corea.
					
					La "Sociedad de Hombres Publicistas de la Religion del Sur de Corea" hizo publico un comentario que censura a las autoridades japonesas por andar enloquecidas por el expansionismo territorial.
					
					La "Solidaridad de Paz Asiatica y Educacion en Historia" sostuvo ese dia una rueda de prensa para condenar categoricamente la distorsion de historia por parte del gobierno japones.
					
					La Solidaridad de Defensa del Islote Tok organizo un mitin frente a la embajada japonesa en el Sur de Corea, en el cual exigio la deportacion inmediata del embajador japones calificando de provocacion malintencionada la tergiversacion de historia por parte del gobierno isleno.
